definition: to resist/to boycott/to refuse (to cooperate)/to reject/resistance/refusal
to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: I can resist everything except temptation" is a very interesting epigram ."
sentences.chinese: “除了誘惑我什麼都能夠抵制”是句非常有趣的雋語。

sentences.english: They also rue the inwardness of Japanese firms that resist co-operating with others.
sentences.chinese: 它們同樣規範日本內部的公司來抵制與其公司的合作。

sentences.english: It will diminish the negative self-talk you may sometimes experience.
sentences.chinese: 它會抵制你偶爾出現的消極的自我暗示。

sentences.english: And some Jews would go along with this and some Jews would resist it.
sentences.chinese: 有些猶太人接受了，有些卻抵制。

sentences.english: How can anyone be expected to resist the tide, the torrent of competing images?
sentences.chinese: 任何一個人怎樣才能抵制這種潮流，競爭物象的潮流。

sentences.english: Non-resistance to the tedium, however, can make it a lot less painful.
sentences.chinese: 不去抵制單調乏味，可以減輕你的痛苦。

sentences.english: Even if it's a little stale, it can be hard to resist.
sentences.chinese: 就算有點變味了，但也還是很難抵制它的誘惑。

sentences.english: We have been guilty of parochialism, of resistance to change.
sentences.chinese: 我們犯了狹隘的錯誤，抵制變革。

sentences.english: Boycott all Chinese Goods until China puts Little Kim back on the dog leash.
sentences.chinese: 抵制所有中國產品，直到中國再給小金拴上狗繩子。

sentences.english: Of course willpower is not all there is to resisting temptation.
sentences.chinese: 當然光靠毅力來抵制誘惑是不夠的。

sentences.english: The Shell-sign resistance movement grew strong and raucous.
sentences.chinese: 殼牌廣告牌抵制運動愈演愈烈。

sentences.english: The audience was amused by his speech full of epigrams.
sentences.chinese: “除了誘惑我什麼都能夠抵制”是句非常有趣的雋語。

sentences.english: Since the boycott's end, Bongiorni has chosen a middle ground.
sentences.chinese: 抵制活動結束後，邦加妮選擇了中間路線。

sentences.english: The president was hobbled by congressional resistance.
sentences.chinese: 總統因國會的抵制而受摯肘。

sentences.english: Bahrain's main opposition party, Wefaq, is boycotting the poll.
sentences.chinese: 巴林的主要反對派維法格黨呼籲抵制選舉。

sentences.english: A. People can resist and undermine the Holy Spirit's sanctifying work in the Gospel.
sentences.chinese: 人們會抵制，削弱聖靈在福音中的成聖工作。

definition: to call on (sb to do sth)/to appeal (to)/an appeal
to fight against/to oppose/to be opposed to/opposition
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
